title: There are different modes you can open a file with, specified by the
mode
c
parameter. These include:

inline_content.Text: There are different modes you can open a file with, specified by the

title: 'r'
c
- reading mode. The default. It allows you only to read the file, not to modify it. When using this mode the file must exist.

inline_content.Text: - reading mode. The default. It allows you only to read the file, not to modify it. When using this mode the file must exist.

title: 'w'
c
- writing mode. It will create a new file if it does not exist, otherwise will erase the file and allow you to write to it.

inline_content.Text: - writing mode. It will create a new file if it does not exist, otherwise will erase the file and allow you to write to it.

title: 'a'
c
- append mode. It will write data to the end of the file. It does not erase the file, and the file must exist for this mode.

inline_content.Text: - append mode. It will write data to the end of the file. It does not erase the file, and the file must exist for this mode.

title: 'rb'
c
- reading mode in binary. This is similar to
r
c
except that the reading is forced in binary mode. This is also a default choice.

inline_content.Text: - reading mode in binary. This is similar to
except that the reading is forced in binary mode. This is also a default choice.

title: 'r+'
c
- reading mode plus writing mode at the same time. This allows you to read and write into files at the same time without having to use
r
c
and
w
c

inline_content.Text: - reading mode plus writing mode at the same time. This allows you to read and write into files at the same time without having to use

title: 'rb+'
c
- reading and writing mode in binary. The same as
r+
c
except the data is in binary

title: 'wb'
c
- writing mode in binary. The same as

c
except the data is in binary.

title: 'w+'
c
- writing and reading mode. The exact same as
r+
c
but if the file does not exist, a new one is made. Otherwise, the file is overwritten.

title: 'a+'
c
- appending and reading mode. Similar to
w+
c
as it will create a new file if the file does not exist. Otherwise, the file pointer is at the end of the file if it exists.

title:
with open(filename, 'r') as f:
    f.read()
with open(filename, 'w') as f:
    f.write(filedata)
with open(filename, 'a') as f:
    f.write('\n' + newdata)

content_resolved.code:
with open(filename, 'r') as f:
    f.read()
with open(filename, 'w') as f:
    f.write(filedata)
with open(filename, 'a') as f:
    f.write('\n' + newdata)
